intro: Asperula cynanchica var. oreophila, commonly known as the alpine asperula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and slopes. Due to its delicate appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes.
